source.title: Thymelaeaceae

leads.lead_text: Involucral bracts usually 6 (but ranging from 4–8), partly reddish or purplish, prominently fringed, not becoming reflexed; alpine and subalpine in north-eastern Victoria
Involucral bracts usually 4 (rarely 5–8), green or partly reddish, usually not fringed, usually reflexed in fruit; montane to lowland forests
